climbs.name: Tough Life
climbs.fa: D. Kohler and B. Massey, August 2017

content.description: Climb up to the first bolt, and then move a little left to get through the bulge. Once above this feature, continue on nice edges that require some finesse but not much power. After the last bolt, move through the broken section below the anchors using cracks and other horizontal features. Fun!
content.protection: Mostly bolts until the top and then you can get some good cams in horizontal cracks. There are lowering anchors at the top.
content.location:
This route is down and right of "

Rainy Day

".

climbs.name: Rainy Day
climbs.fa: C. Fields, D. Kohler, B. Massey, August 2017

content.description: Start this route by climbing to a high first bolt on positive edges. Continue up past several bolts and a few horizontal cam placements. After the last bolt, you can head up a bit left to a right-facing corner that goes at 5.8 or go right and wander up the face through some 5.9 climbing with some gear placements in the cracks.
content.protection: This route is mostly bolted but there are options for gear placements. Take these options or you will be faced with a runout. There are lowering anchors at the top.
content.location: This route sits in the middle of the wall and is right of the grungy crack.

content.description: This is the leftmost route on the Lower-Tier. It starts on clean rock with a greenish color. Surmount a mini-roof before traversing right and then up to another mini-roof. The second roof is the crux. You can get through this section a few different ways. Depending on the way you choose will either increase/decrease the grade. After this, cruise to the anchors!
content.location: After locating "Strip Mall," look up and left, and you will see the bolt line.
